meanings.definition: Make a series of quick, high-pitched sounds, as a bird or small rodent.
meanings.sent1: The birds were chittering happily in the trees.
meanings.sent2: I heard the squirrels chittering in the park.
meanings.sent3: The chittering of the birds added a cheerful melody to the morning.
meanings.sent4: The chittering of the crickets filled the night with music.
meanings.sent5: The chittering of the chipmunks echoed through the forest.

meanings.sent1: I found the chittering of the birds soothing.
meanings.sent2: The constant chittering in the room was distracting.
meanings.sent3: The chittering of the squirrels sounded like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: The chittering of the audience filled the theater with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The chittering of the children at play was a joyful symphony.
